required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Gender Differences in the Tolerance to Stretch
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Stretching on Pain Sensitivity - Potential Gender Differences?

brief_summary.textblock: The effect of stretching on range of motion is believed to rely upon an increased tolerance to stretch. This suggests, that pain modulation has significance in regards to the effect of stretching.

detailed_description.textblock: Given that there may be differences in the way men and women perceive a painful stimulus, this suggests that there may be potential gender differences in the tolerance to stretch following stretching.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Passive knee extension range of motion was measured at baseline just prior to Muscle stretching exercises
primary_outcome.description: Passive knee extension Range of motion

primary_outcome.time_frame: Passive knee extension range of motion was measured 30 seconds after Muscle stretching exercises
primary_outcome.description: Passive knee extension Range of motion

primary_outcome.time_frame: Pressure pain Thresholds were measured at baseline just prior to muscle stretching exercises
Pressure pain Thresholds were measured 30 seconds after muscle stretching exercises
Passive resistive torque was measured at baseline just prior to muscle stretching exercises
Passive resistive torque was measured 30 seconds after muscle stretching exercises

arm_group.description: Static Muscle stretching exercises of the knee flexors
Static Muscle stretching exercises of the knee flexors

intervention.description: Muscle stretching exercises consisting of static stretching exercises of the knee flexors

study_pop.textblock: Healthy male and female volunteers between the ages of 18 to 45 are eligible for participation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Absence of any pain or other conditions which might affect the somatosensory system and pain perception
Exclusion Criteria:
- Substance abuse, History of neurological or mental disabilities, Lack of ability to comply with instructions, Delayed onset of muscle soreness

overall_official.affiliation: University College of Northern Denmark, Department of Physiotherapy

patient_data.ipd_description: IPD (range of motion, PPT and Torque data) will be shared upon request
